intro: Acmadenia flaccida, commonly known as the slender acmadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters, typically during spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Acmadenia flaccida is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
